title: Homicide Investigation Unveiled Following the Deaths of Film Icon Rob Reiner and Spouse Michele
summary: The deaths of Hollywood luminary Rob Reiner and his wife Michele have prompted a homicide investigation after they were discovered deceased in their Los Angeles residence. Authorities, including the Los Angeles Police Department and Fire Department, responded to an emergency call at the couple's upscale Brentwood home on Sunday afternoon, with the incident being treated as an apparent homicide. Reiner, acclaimed for directing seminal films such as When Harry Met Sally and This is Spinal Tap, leaves behind a legacy spanning decades in the entertainment industry. A family spokesperson issued a formal statement expressing profound sorrow and requesting privacy, while tributes have emerged from influential figures, including former President Barack Obama and Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Police details indicate that a 78-year-old man and 68-year-old woman were pronounced dead at the scene, though official identification and circumstances remain undisclosed. No arrests have been made, and no suspects are currently sought, as robbery homicide detectives delve into the case. At a press conference, Deputy Chief Alan Hamilton revealed that the bodies were still present hours post-response, with the cause of death pending determination by the LA coroner's office. Reiner, son of comedic legend Carl Reiner, launched his career in the 1960s and achieved prominence through his role in the groundbreaking TV sitcom All in The Family, garnering two Emmy Awards and establishing a multifaceted career in film direction.
